intro: Symbolanthus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved symbolanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
